metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2179 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in config.c in config.cgi in (1) Nagios 3.2.3 and (2) Icinga before 1.4.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the expand parameter, as demonstrated by an (a) command action or a (b) hosts action.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icinga - 1.10.3-1
icinga-cgi - 1.10.3-1
icinga-cgi-bin - 1.10.3-1
icinga-common - 1.10.3-1
icinga-core - 1.10.3-1
icinga-idoutils - 1.10.3-1
No subscription required

nagios3 - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-cgi - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-common - 3.2.3-3
nagios3-core - 3.2.3-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> feature was introduced in nagios 3.2.2, icinga 1.3.1

criterions.comment: icinga package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1').
nagios3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-3').
